item.title: Different ways to make wrappers in Scala 2.x
item.description: I made this article to overview different approaches to make wrappers in Scala. Wrapper pattern is useful to add additional logic to methods of a class: logging, metering, tracing, timeouts, retries. Scala is a great language and provides many ways to create wrappers. I decided to create this article because it seems that there’s no consensus between Scala developers on how to write them and no clear understanding of downsides and limitations.
